title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Liquefied Natural Gas (LNG) and Natural Gas Infrastructure, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will support U.S. private sector participation in the implementation of gas infrastructure in Association of Southeast Asian Nation (ASEAN) region. The RTM supports USTDA's Liquefied Natural Gas Supply and Natural Gas Training Cooperation Program with Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI). The RTM will share best practices for value-based natural gas infrastructure planning and technical capacity building and support opportunities for U.S. exports to emerging ASEAN markets. This funding in the amount of $49,118 is being added to the fixed cost budget within the contract award for the Bilateral Chamber.

participating-org.narrative: National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

title.narrative: Rail Maintenance, Safety and Efficiency Reverse Trade Mission (RTM), through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) supports U.S. private sector participation in the development of rail safety, maintenance and efficiency infrastructure in India and Bangladesh. The RTM supports USTDA's goal of developing freight rail infrastructure in emerging markets and the Governments of India and Bangladesh's intent to improve and expand rail infrastructure. The RTM will share best practices for value-based rail infrastructure planning and support opportunities for U.S. rail exports to India and Bangladesh.

title.narrative: 2019 Indo-Pacific Business Forum, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: This contract funds the Indo-Pacific Business Forum, which brings together senior U.S. and regional government officials with business officials to advance the objectives of the Indo-Pacific vision. The forum will be held in Thailand and include representatives from across the Indo-Pacific.

title.narrative: Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: This grant funds a feasibility study for Vietnam Electricity, the State-owned power company in Vietnam, to develop the Southern Vietnam Liquified Natual Gas (LNG) Terminal and Gas-to Power Project. The Study will assess the site selection and development of the LNG terminal-including LNG storage, regasification, and related infrastructure-to allow assesment of the use of LNG as a fuel source for power generation and to plan necessary terminal vessel services.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Amy Swers and Liz Sutton; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series, through Futron Corporation

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting a series of six (6) Southeast Asia Aviation Workshops to provide a broad range of managerial, technical, safety, efficiency, capacity, and operational training to key officials from civil aviation authorities, airport management groups, air navigation providers, and individual airport operators in Southeast Asia. The workshops serve as a forum where representatives from U.S. industry and government engage Southeast Asian counterparts to collaborate on best practices, standards, and policy development for the region's aviation industry. This funding in the amount of $177,922 is being added to the Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series, bringing the new total of funding to $866,922. The funding in the amount of $182,598 is being added to the Southeast Asia Aviation Workshop Series to cover the travel costs for up to ten Southeast Asian aviation representatives to attend each of the six separate and distinct workshops, and to add a networking reception to each workshop. In addition, this memorandum allows USTDA to invite likeminded country representatives to participate in the workshops to advance regional aviation cooperation in Southeast Asia.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - ASEAN Cybersecurity and Digital Solutions Reverse Trade Mission Series, through Business Council for International Understanding

description.narrative: The ASEAN Cybersecurity and Digital Solutions Reverse Trade Mission Series consists of two separate and distinct RTMs designed to familiarize leaders from financial institutions and utility companies in the ASEAN region with state-of-the-art U.S. ICT technologies, services, and best practice for cybersecurity and digital solutions. The primary objective of the RTM series is to support the capacity of ASEAN banks and utility companies to mitigate risks to digital infrastructure and optimize operations by enhancing their cybersecurity and digital capabilities. This memorandum serves as a no-cost modification to the decision and project memoranda for the ASEAN Cybersecurity and Digital Solutions Reverse Trade Mission Series (USTDA Activity No. 2019-31018A). The change allows USTDA to invite Solomon Islands central bank representatives to participate in the Reverse Trade Mission as delegates.

title.narrative: Small Modular Reactor Regulations and Civil Nuclear Energy Standards Workshop, through The Webster Group

description.narrative: USTDA funding is supporting a series of six Small Modular Reactor (SMR) Regulations and Civil Nuclear Energy Standards Workshops to provide to support the U.S. SMR Public Private Partnership. The workshops will provide assistance to industry and government in developing effective regulatory frameworks, addressing challenges in the deployment of SMR technologies, and assisting U.S. companies to engage with opportunities in USTDA-eligible countries in Europe and Eurasia.

title.narrative: Airport Checkpoint Design RTM, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This USTDA-funded reverse trade mission (RTM) will support the travel of Indo-Pacific aviation security officials and airport representatives to attend the TSA International Design Symposium in the United States. The RTM will familiarize delegates with TSA airport checkpoint design requirements and best practices and introduce delegates to U.S. aviation security technologies.

title.narrative: Reverse Trade Mission - Liquified Natural Gas Supply and Natural Gas Infrastructure Reverse Trade Mission Series, through National US Arab Chamber Of Commerce (Inc)

description.narrative: This contract funds a reverse trade mission series for two separate and distinct reverse trade missions to introduce delegates from the government and private sectors in Thailand and Vietnam to U.S. technology, regulations and best practices in the gas infrastructure and liquefied natural gas import industries. The delegates will travel to three cities in the United States in order to meet with U.S. companies and conduct site visits to see American technology manufactured and in use.
